TopicTitle: How do I whitelist the patcher in my firewall?

Articles.Content: We recently got a new router at my house, and unlike the previous one it comes with a built-in firewall. This has been causing no shortage of problems with Minecraft, FTP and, as I've just discovered, KSP. When I try to start the launcher, the patcher gets stuck at "Checking for updates," and I suspect it's something to do with the firewall. Does anyone know what IPs and ports KSP uses for checking and downloading patches so I can whitelist it?

This has nothing to do with your firewall. It is a problem with the website and the launcher. Causing the launcher just to be on a looking for update the patcher dosnt work either

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-28T00:04:03Z" title="04/28/2015 12:04  AM" data-short="9 yr">April 28, 2015</time> by Ethanadams**
Any luck getting the launcher to work? It hasn't worked for me all day today.
